page.title: 01WORMBRIDGE - MAIN FEATURES
page.content: The{Hereford-Newport railway}and the A465 road run from NE to SW. The {Wormbrook}runs from the NE under the railway and road,joining the river Done in the SE corner. West of the brook is part of an{army {training area,}with army living quarters, offices and lecture halls, a radio mast area and a training area used as rough grazing. Below the tiny church of{Kender}there is a large saw mill and opposite {Wormbridge Church}is a two class primary school.East of the railway large pylons carry a main electric power line. The area is mainly farming land with scattered woods. Two private estates own land, the Kentchurch estate much of the southern part, and the Whitfield land in the extreme north.Other land is mainly owner occupied.
